text: 2015 World Cup qualification match in Sweden The Scotland women's national football team represents Scotland in international women's football competitions. Since 1998, the team has been governed by the Scottish Football Association (SFA). Scotland qualified in the FIFA Women's World Cup for the first time in 2019, and qualified for their first UEFA Women's Euro in 2017. This list includes all players who have made at least one appearance for the national team. In July 2017, the SFA launched the Women's International Roll of Honour, which recognises players who have won 100 or more caps for the national team. The women's roll of honour initially included 12 players. ==List of players== ;Key {| class="wikitable" |- |style="background- color:#FFCCCC"|* |Still active for the national team |- |Caps
